concept.title: Touch UI utilities API
concept.shortdesc: The Touch UI utilities API is used for detecting long-tap events and showing an animation for them.

conbody.p: A long tap, also called a touch down and hold event, means that the user holds the stylus down on the screen at the same point for a long time.

fig.title: Long-tap event used for opening a stylus pop-up menu

conbody.p: The Touch UI utilities API can be used in all GUI applications. It is a library API that provides an interface for constructing and using the long-tap detector component.
For user experience guidelines on the long-tap component, see Touch down and hold.
For the Touch UI utilities API classes and header files, see Classes and Definitions.
For implementation information, see Receiving long tap events.

section.title: Error handling
section.p: The leave mechanism of the Symbian platform environment is used for handling memory exhaustion.

section.title: Changes and release information
section.p: The Touch UI utilities API is an SDK API and first released in S60 5th Edition.

section.title: Constraints
section.p: This API is valid for all touch enabled Symbian platforms.

section.title: Emulator support
section.p: This API is fully supported in the WINS/WINSCW emulator environment.
